data.author: Chih-Hung Tseng
data.message:
Use the environment variable SHOW_NON_RECURRENT_CALLERS (#12)

As discussed in PR#11, Using SHOW_NON_RECURRENT_CALLERS can make our
intention clearly. When this environment variable is set to 1, the backtraces
are written to logs regardless of how many malloc/new are called by the call sites.

Co-authored-by: chtseng <chtseng@itri.org.tw>

data.author: Chih-Hung Tseng
data.message:
Trace the call sites that make malloc/new operations. (#11)

malloc/new operations introduce indeterminism to execution time as kernel need to
handle dynamic memory allocation. This patch reveals the call sites that made
the most malloc/new. An additional python script is also created to reveal
detailed filenames and line numbers of the callers if such information is available.

Co-authored-by: chtseng <chtseng@itri.org.tw>

data.author: Takumi Jin
data.message:
Separated policy and mechanism (#7)

* Created the basis for replacing the GLIBC allocator

* Add a usage description to the README.md

* Added GlobalAllocator documents in README.md

* Added description about heap tracer

modified heap tracer a little.

* remove some files

* put title in heaptrack graph

* Add the description about test in README.md

* add memalign test

* make test simple

devide into test_heaphook and test_glibc

* add calloc test

* add posix_memalign test

* add memalign test

* add aligned_alloc test

* add valloc test and pvalloc test

* add realloc test

* modified alloc_test in allocator_test

* modified alloc_zeroed test in test_allocator.cpp

* add realloc test in test_allocator.cpp

* split CMakeLists.txt into project_utils.cmake

* add multi-thread test in test_allocator.cpp

* modified project_utils.cmake

* implements do_get_block_size in TlsfAllocator

* Implements do_alloc_zeroed in TlsfAllocator

* comment out invalid args test

* some outputs turned off

* python3 code made flake8 compliant

* Format files to pass lint test.
